structures.name: Actionable
structures.description: How can people do something, step-by-step?

structures.name: Motivational
structures.description: Inspire people to take action through a story or anecdote.

structures.name: Analytical
structures.description: Do a tear down of a company, person, content style, etc.

structures.name: Contrarian
structures.description: Something you feel differently about vs. the status quo.

structures.name: Observation
structures.description: What's something you've observed that you can talk about?

structures.name: X vs. Y
structures.description: Compare two situations for an interesting takeaway

structures.name: Present / Future
structures.description: How things work today vs. how you think in the future?

structures.name: Listicle
structures.description: A list of things (top books, people, podcasts, etc.) PLEASE USE SPARINGLY.

structures.name: Upcoming Week
structures.description: What are you working on this week?

structures.name: Highs/Lows
structures.description: What went well and what went poorly. Usually good for a friday.

trailer: There are 3 secrets every 7-figure business owner knows about email marketing…
meat: 7-figure business: Sends a Friday newsletter with customer wins
5-figure business: Sends no newsletter at all.
7-figure business: Segments their customers using email marketing.
5 figure business: Has no built in segmentation for their customers.

niche_methods.name: Demographics
niche_methods.examples: Gender, age, income level, education level

niche_methods.name: Geographics
niche_methods.examples: Residents of a certain country, city, or even neighborhood

questions.question: What is a broad topic I know extremely well?
What's a niche I know even better?
Who do you help in that sub-niche?
Finish here after "Listening for customer problems"
What problem do you help them overcome?
What outcome, specifically, do you help them achieve?

elements.example: I got fired 3 times between the ages 21 and 28. Never made a sale. Never hit a quota.
I didn't know what I was good at or if I was going to be successful.
My buddies all ridiculed me for it, and for living in small towns across the US.
I took a bus ride to NYC to interview at ZocDoc.
I was blown away by an intersection: the team, the product, the culture, and the energy of the city.
